title: Kafka Trigger
description: Consume messages from a Kafka topic

topic.description: Name of the queue of topic to consume from

resolveOffset.description: Select on which condition the offsets should be resolved. In the manual mode, when execution started by clicking on Execute Workflow or Execute Step button, offsets are always resolved immediately after message received.
x-enumDescriptions: Resolve offset after execution completion regardless of the status
Resolve offset only if execution status equals success
Resolve offset only if execution status in the list of selected statuses
Resolve offset immediately after message received. This option is not recommended as it can cause messages loss.

useSchemaRegistry.description: Whether to use Confluent Schema Registry

allowAutoTopicCreation.description: Whether to allow sending message to a previously non-existing topic

autoCommitThreshold.description: The consumer will commit offsets after resolving a given number of messages

autoCommitInterval.description: The consumer will commit offsets after a given period, for example, five seconds

batchSize.description: Number of messages to process in each batch, when set to 1, message-by-message processing is enabled

eachBatchAutoResolve.description: Whether to auto resolve offsets for each batch

fetchMaxBytes.description: Maximum amount of data the server should return for a fetch request. In bytes. Default is 1MB. Higher values allow fetching more messages at once.

fetchMinBytes.description: Minimum amount of data the server should return for a fetch request. In bytes. Server will wait up to fetchMaxWaitTime for this amount to accumulate.

heartbeatInterval.description: Heartbeats are used to ensure that the consumer's session stays active

maxInFlightRequests.description: The maximum number of unacknowledged requests the client will send on a single connection

fromBeginning.description: Whether to read message from beginning

jsonParseMessage.description: Whether to try to parse the message to an object

keepBinaryData.description: Whether to keep message value as binary data for downstream processing (e.g., Avro deserialization)

parallelProcessing.description: Whether to process messages in parallel resolving offsets independently or in order resolving offsets after execution completion. In the manual mode, when execution started by clicking on Execute Workflow or Execute Step button, messages are processed in parallel resolving offsets immediately.

partitionsConsumedConcurrently.description: Number of Kafka partitions to process in parallel. Controls how many partitions are processed concurrently by the consumer.

onlyMessage.description: Whether to return only the message property

returnHeaders.description: Whether to return the headers received from Kafka

rebalanceTimeout.description: The maximum time allowed for a consumer to join the group

errorRetryDelay.description: Delay in milliseconds before retrying after a failed offset resolution. This prevents rapid retry loops that could overwhelm the Kafka broker.

sessionTimeout.description: Timeout in milliseconds used to detect failures. Has to be higher than Heartbeat Interval. During the workflow execution heartbeat will be sent periodically to keep the session alive with configured Heartbeat Interval.
